unnormalised: In a shocking turn of events, 32 yr old Rakesh Sharma from Delhi was rushed to AIIMS this morning after experiencing severe abdominal pain & vomiting blood. Sharma, a software engineer, had been complaining of discomfort for the past few days but attributed it to stress from his new project.
normalised: In a shocking turn of events, thirty two year old Rakesh Sharma from Delhi was rushed to A-I-I-M-S this morning after experiencing severe abdominal pain and vomiting blood. Sharma, a software engineer, had been complaining of discomfort for the past few days but attributed it to stress from his new project.

unnormalised: According to Dr. Gupta, the leading gastroenterologist on call, initial tests indicate a possible case of acute peptic ulcer disease. "We're running further tests, including an endoscopy, to confirm the diagnosis and rule out any other complications," Dr. Gupta stated at a press briefing held at 2:00 PM. Sharma's family, including his wife Priya & parents, are anxiously awaiting updates.
normalised: According to Doctor Gupta, the leading gastroenterologist on call, initial tests indicate a possible case of acute peptic ulcer disease. "We are running further tests, including an endoscopy, to confirm the diagnosis and rule out any other complications," Doctor Gupta stated at a press briefing held at two p.m. Sharma's family, including his wife Priya and parents, are anxiously awaiting updates.

unnormalised: The incident highlights the growing concern around lifestyle-related health issues in young adults. Experts emphasize the importance of regular check-ups & a balanced diet. "Many young professionals are so focused on their careers that they neglect their health. Simple measures, like avoiding spicy foods & reducing stress, can make a big difference," says Dr. Patel, a general physician practicing in South Delhi.
normalised: The incident highlights the growing concern around lifestyle-related health issues in young adults. Experts emphasize the importance of regular check-ups and a balanced diet. "Many young professionals are so focused on their careers that they neglect their health. Simple measures, like avoiding spicy foods and reducing stress, can make a big difference," says Doctor Patel, a general physician practicing in South Delhi.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, authorities at AIIMS have assured the public that Sharma is receiving the best possible care. They’ve also initiated a full investigation into the possible causes of his condition. A detailed report is expected to be released on 18/10/2024.
normalised: Meanwhile, authorities at A-I-I-M-S have assured the public that Sharma is receiving the best possible care. They have also initiated a full investigation into the possible causes of his condition. A detailed report is expected to be released on eighteenth October two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: This case serves as a stark reminder to prioritize our health & seek medical attention promptly when experiencing unusual symptoms. The hospital bill is already estimated to be around ₹75,000. More updates will be provided as the situation unfolds.
normalised: This case serves as a stark reminder to prioritize our health and seek medical attention promptly when experiencing unusual symptoms. The hospital bill is already estimated to be around rupee seventy five thousand. More updates will be provided as the situation unfolds.
